item.title: I knew I'd enjoy Rubato's demo from the moment the Earth blew up and I fell in the toilet
item.content:encoded:
Sonic the Hedgefrog was a better pun, actually

Rubato is "an experimental, 2D physics-based take on the collect-a-thon genre", according to developer dconn, which doesn't really do justice to the below trailer full of screaming skulls and mode7 first-person driving bits and fleeting Minecraft references and PS1-era dancefloors. I guess I'm too used to the watering down of "experimental" as a descriptor. The blurb doesn't even communicate that you play as a frog. Seemingly. Fortunately, there is a demo. Please watch the trailer while I go play it.

OK, I'm back from my brief demo time with some quick and dirty bulletpoints. It doesn't feel appropriate to attempt a holistic account off the back of five minutes, but I would score those five minutes 8/10, if such things were permitted round these parts. It's sort of a cursed Mega Drive romhack, but funnier. Anyway, here are those bullets.

  • Press ESC button to start - sort of edgy!
  • Banger Mega Drive-esque music
  • Earth go boom
  • fell into toilet
  • toilet is a tutorial level
  • tips given by smaller dancing toilet that looks like prehistoric Tumblr gif
  • Frog is Sonic?
  • I like Sognic's rocking-chair movement
  • Sognic can swing and throw 2D crates like some kind of golden era Flash puzzler
  • Playing pool with planets?
  • The Company?
  • Space Police?
  • Fell into Bakery
  • Even bangerer music
  • Press O to explode?

Rubato is out on March 20th. That much we can report with reasonable confidence. You can read more and try the demo yourself on Itch.io and Steam.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/i-knew-id-enjoy-rubatos-demo-from-the-moment-the-earth-blew-up-and-i-fell-in-the-toilet
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Steam's 'complete the set' bundles can now be gifted, with bits your mates already own accounted for
item.content:encoded:
You've now got no excuse not to dump about £100 of other Fallout on someone who's trying New Vegas for the first time

If you've been waiting to bless one of your friends with an entire dump truck worth of games in a series they've enjoyed one entry of, then good news. Valve have made Steam's 'complete the set' bundles giftable, with prices adjusting to match whichever bits the recipient might already own - so you're not in danger of hurling someone their second copy of Fallout 4 on one storefront.

The steamywatchers over at SteamDB were the first to spot that this sort of bundle gifting's now allowed. I've given it a quick test that involved momentarily holding the nearly £120 Fallout series bundle over the heads of several Steam friends.

You'll be glad to hear that the price changed in relation to the games in the bundle they already owned, just as happens if you go to buy one of these bundles for your own account. For one friend, I'd be playing somewhere in the region of £87 for the bits required to totally drown them in rads, while another would set me back only £71. That is, of course still wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy too much to pay to make sure someone owns both Fallout Tactics and Fallout 76's extra fishing gear, but hey, maybe next time the sale rolls around.

Regardless, it's a handy feature for Steam to offer. Not being able to dump all of the Yakuza/Like A Dragons on your mum at Christmas, alongside an email linking this article ain't right. Now, to wait a full year for the opportunity to do it.

In other recent Steam-related news, Valve have revamped their community award emojis in an effort to stop people deliberately writing anger-inducing and clown sticker-attracting posts in order to earn Steam points they can spend on fancy profile backgrounds. I'm sure it'll work and I'll soon be able to read a discussion thread or review section without the risk of rolling my eyes so hard they plop out onto my desk.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/steams-complete-the-set-bundles-can-now-be-gifted-with-bits-your-mates-already-own-accounted-for
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot
